tags.name: ITR Request
tags.description: Temperature Score API call for portfolio environmental impact evaluation.

post.summary: Retrieve the temperature score for your portfolio of companies

anonymize_data_dump.description: Whether or not the resulting data set should be anonymized or not.

aggregation_method.description: The aggregation method that should be used.

data_providers.description: The names of the data providers that should be used. To get a list of data providers, use the /data_providers endpoint.

default_score.description: The score that should be used when no target is available.

scenario.description: The scenario that should be used. This will change (some of the) targets, to simulate a what-if scenario.

filter_time_frame.description: The time frames that should be included in the results

filter_scope_category.description: The scopes that should be included in the results

include_columns.description: The names of the columns that should be included in the output

grouping_columns.description: The names of the columns by which the aggregated temperature scores should be grouped. In addition to the column names defined in the enum, you can also specify a custom column name that was included in the uploaded portfolio.

aggregation_method.description: The aggregation method that should be used.

data_providers.description: The names of the data providers that should be used. To get a list of data providers, use the /data_providers endpoint.

number.description:
The ID of the scenario. 
 * `1` - In scenario 1 we engage companies to set targets. This means that the default score (i.e. the score when a company didn't set a target) will be set to 2 degrees celcius. 
 * `2` - In scenario 2 we engage companies to have their targets validated by the SBTi. This means that the maximum score for all targets will be capped at 1.75 degrees celcius. 
 * `3` In scenario 3a we engage the top 10 contributors. How they are engaged depends on the `engagement_type` parameter. 
 * `4` In scenario 4 we engage a predefined list of company (those that have the value 'true' in the 'engagement_target' column in the portfolio). How they are engaged depends on the `engagement_type` parameter.

engagement_type.description:
The engagement type, i.e. how the companies should be engaged. This parameter is only used for scenarios 3 and 4. 
 * `SET_TARGETS` The companies are engaged to set targets. This means that their temperature scores are capped at 2 degrees celsius.  
 * `SET_SBTI_TARGETS` The companies are engaged to set SBTi approved targets. This means that their temperature scores are capped at 1.75 degrees celsius.

aggregated_scores.description: The aggregated scores, split by time-frame, scope and the grouping column.

scores.description: A dump of the raw target/company data.

coverage.description: The coverage of the SBTi approved targets (as a percentage).

companies.description: The raw data used to calculate the aggregated scores. Each company is included 9 times, once for each time-frame/scope combination.

feature_distribution.description: For each group that can be made using the grouping columns, the number of companies in that group.
